intro: Randia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Randia rostrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
